Tucson knew he would now have to rely on his tracking abilities to follow w=
ho or what ever was in the dark pit.  He quietly walks up to where he had s=
een the figure, and examines the ground below.  He checks for imprints and =
indications of a struggle, it was still a tad dark.  He kneels down and shi=
nes his headlights onto it.  Nothing.  Whatever moisture had made it into t=
he area, had wiped out any indication of where the object had been moved.

=
"Frag..  This is going to be harder than I thought."  

In frustration he l=
eans up against the wall of the pit, trying to gather his thoughts.  He had=
 not been able to read Kup's information due to the fact that he had been r=
endered blind for a long time.  He was going completely on instinct and mos=
t of the time, he knew what he was doing.  This however was proving challen=
ging to him, since he had never been this far into the pit.  He picks up a =
familliar energy signature though, one comming from the Ark.  It was a star=
t.  Soon his frustration turns to concentration as he now puts a few things=
 together.

" Energy signature coming from the Ark...  I'm pointing due Nor=
th, and - it seems to be stronger as I point in that direction.  All right =
then, This tunnel must lead back to the Ark, and if so...  I wonder...  Rod=
imus, where the Slag are you?"

Outside, Night Shift nodds, and looks to Pe=
rceptor.  He would take on the task of bringing Windlord to the Arks' CR ch=
amber, as Rat Trap follows him in his cab.

" No worries, Perceptor, Legacy=
, I'll get Windlord'n Rat Trap back ta the Ark, Rat Trap's a real ace when =
it comes ta operatn' the CR chambers."

Rat Trap punches in a few numbers i=
n his wrist pannel.

" Not only that but I can have them powered up'n ready=
 for use by the time we get there.  Nightlight'll need a CR chamber that's =
already powered up.  Sounds like we can't waste any time in gettn' her sort=
ed out."

Night Shift starts his engine and turns around in the direction o=
f the Ark.

"Okay, we're outa here Legacy.  We're gon' back with Windlord'n=
 hopefully help Kup ta get Nightlight sorted out too.  Wish us luck."

In t=
rying to get to Tucson as fast as she could, Straight Shot tries to look fo=
r an available aircraft, but finds none.  She gets ready to travel on foot,=
 she finds a tunnel underground.  Faintly she picks up on Tucson's energy s=
ignature.

" If my sensors are right, which most of the time they are, Tucs=
on's down there. How far, that's another story..  Well, this is it, I'm goi=
ng in."

She slides down into the tunnel, and picks up Tucson's com link.

=
"Tucson, this is Straight Shot, do you copy?"

Tucson picks up her signal.
=

" I copy that.  I'm looking for Rodimus.  No sign of him."

Straight Shot =
sighs.

" No one said it would be easy..  Wait a miute, if you had your son=
ar transmitter you'd be able to pick up on him, simply by echolocation.. I'=
m not far from Kup, I'll get it, meet up with you, and we're in business."
=

Tucson Replies

"Sonar, echolocation... Each person and object bounces off=
 their own frequency.  Now why didn't I think of that?  Good thinking Strai=
ght Shot.  I'll wait for you where I am, and I will send you a honing signa=
l to reach me.  Go back, as Kup for my transmitter and bring it here.  Afte=
r that we'll probably be able to locate Rodimus."

Straight Shot salutes, a=
nd goes back up to the Ark and looks for Kup.
She darts around quickly and =
soon finds him.

"Kup, sir, Tucson's all right, he's beneath in the tunnel =
that leads here to the Ark.  He says he needs his transmitter and I can bri=
ng it to him.  With that he hopes to locate Rodimus.  Could I please have i=
t back?"

Rat Trap now reports to Lord Elder.

"Rat Trap ta Lord Elder.  Ni=
ghtshift'n I have Windlord and we're headed home.  I'm gettn cross transmis=
sions now, and Wheels is okay.  He doesn't know where Rodimus is but thinks=
 he might just be able ta swing it via echolocation, when he gets back his =
transmitter of course.  Straight Shot's takn' care of that now, we'll handl=
e Windlord's recovery.  I've activated the CR chamber so it'll be warmed up=
 on our arrival.  Rat Trap out."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Ca=
rroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> Who: LEGACY, Rat Trap, Tuscon, Quickst=
ride, Kup
> Location: Area outside of the Black Fortress
> 
> > "Lord Elder=
, Perceptor, I want you to know that if you were to chose between saving yo=
ur own life, and the lives of your comrades, you would probably want to sav=
e your comrades instead of yourselves. The compassion for a comrade has far=
 out powered my better judgement for survival. I can not deny what my heart=
 spark tells me. And it has told me that there is no greater power than tha=
t which is held by all Autobots and Maximals a like. Rat Trap, I hear you t=
oo, I know this is upsetting you greatly, and if you had not extended your =
own heart spark to help me the first time, I would not have made it this fa=
r. All of you who worry for me, take heart, I've been through worse. And pl=
ease, understand that I failed Rodimus once, I will not fail him a second t=
ime."
> 
> "Of course." Lord elder responded back. "But if I were attemptin=
g to
> do the same thing that you were doing, what would you be saying." He=

> sighed, knowing that even as he spoke that Tuscon had already gone on
> =
anyway.
> 
> > " By the Matrix.. Lord Elder, Legacy, Perceptor, I've got my=
 vision back. I can now see everything around me clearly. Now, I can also h=
ear Rodimus on the other end. I'm attempting to get through the rubble, but=
 it may take a moment or so to do it."
> >
> > As he continues to dig, he k=
eeps an ear out for Rodimus.
> >
> > "Rodimus, if you can hear me, I need y=
ou to follow my voice and dig through the rubble on your end, to meet up wi=
th me. I've got my vision back and I am now fully capable of getting us bot=
h out of here safely. Please, respond."
> 
> As Tuscon dug and pushed, the =
debris rumbled. As anyone knows, once
> there has been a land slide, to mov=
e the supporting debris only risks
> another slide. The dirt and such that =
Tuscon moves is light and sandy,
> had he been a farmer, no doubt he would =
have realized that this
> accounts for much of the scrub that grew around t=
his area, the soil
> had so little nutrients, built as it was on volcanic r=
ock beneath.
> 
> However when Tuscon was finally able to break through to =
the other
> side there was no Rodimus to see or any of the other Decepticon=
s for
> that matter: Cyclonus, Scourge, Scorponok and Jhiaxus were all abse=
nt.
> Instead there was only the opening of some large pit, perhaps 15 or 2=
0
> feet across from which the smell of sulfur and other strange gasses
> r=
ose.
> 
> Had Tuscon read the old reports of Kup and Grimlock's tunneling
>=
 expedition while following Scorponok, then he might connect that to
> the =
pit he saw before him. It ran deep, its sides sloping down rather
> sharply=
, although the floor of it was exceedingly smooth. It was part
> of the ori=
ginal tunnel that led far underground and in the direction
> of the Ark.
> =

> Perhaps several hundred yards down the tunnel/pit there was a dark
> for=
m, something that MIGHT be Rodimus. Who or what ever it was it lay
> totall=
y unmoving, unresponsive to anything that Tuscon has done so
> far.
> 
> Bu=
t then the sound of water could be heard as if some small
> underground dam=
 had burst, and then steam began billowing up from the
> hole obscuring sig=
ht. The last view Tuscon could see of the figure was
> that it moved, as if=
 pushed by something, and then it was totally lost
> from sight.
> 
> 
> Me=
anwhile . . .
> 
> Who: LEGACY, Rat Trap, Quickstride, Kup
> Location: Area=
 outside of the Black Fortress
> 
> > " That's a good hope ta have Quickstr=
ide. We gotta believe in Tucson, guys. That's our greatest power, believe i=
n our allies and our friends. Somethn' Hydras doesn't usually practice."
> =
>
> > Night Shift turns to Legacy.
> >
> > " Belief is all we got gon' for =
us now Legacy. We gotta hold onta that."
> 
> Legacy paused as he listened =
to the others as his own sensors
> continued to scan the area.
> 
> "Belief=
 is inconsequential if it cannot be supported by fact." Legacy
> said, ever=
 the bot that was rooted in empirical logic. "Historically
> Optimus Prime =
was renowned for his ability to act in unpredictable
> ways and still emerg=
e victorious, as was Optimus Primal. However
> neither of them are still wi=
th us."
> 
> "I would suspect that Tuscon is now motivated by the emotions =
of guilt
> and fear. Guilt that he has allowed Rodimus to left behind and f=
ear
> that he may be lost again. Hardly the motivators that allow for the
>=
 optimal success for his mission."
> 
> Legacy transformed into robot mode,=
 setting down anyone who may still
> have been riding inside of him. "I wou=
ld recommend that Talon or Rat
> Trap take the injured back to the ark in t=
he shuttle and then the rest
> of us attempt to locate Tuscon and Rodimus."=

> 
> Legacy's cold cyclopian gaze swept the group as he spoke. "We cannot
=
> know the condition of the Predacons or Decepticon, and if in his
> curren=
t state that Tuscon has not pushed himself into another
> situation that it=
 will be difficult to extricate himself from alone."
>
